subtitle: hello and welcome to a thousand years of ashkenaz my name is henry abramson and i'm proud to be your
instructor for this online course the reason for this experimental online course is because
i'm proud to be serving in a few months as a guest lecturer at the ashkenazium which is a
brilliant new educational initiative launched by my friend and colleague dr michael keagle
in hungary and the idea of the ashkenazium is to cover all aspects of the phenomenal ashkenazic
culture of europe now since this is a graduate level program but most of the students come to
this program with training in different areas my course is designed to be a very quick survey
of basically a thousand years of ashkenazic history and to support their preparation for
the intense lectures and class discussions that we will have in budapest i was asked to put together
some videos luckily i have a few videos that i can draw from more than actually is necessary
but since i put this thing together i thought why not open it up to a larger audience
so i invite you to participate with us in this global discussion of the tremendous
treasures of ashkenazic history this is what we're basically going to do in the course
the course will begin with the earliest ashkenaz settlement and then travel through much of
the political social economic and religious developments of the next uh several hundred
years right up until the present day in each of the modules there will be a selection of videos
which are all available on my youtube channel so you know if you don't want to participate in this
class that's fine you can find them the problem is they're kind of buried in with lots of other
things that i've done over the many years so the the courses will be organized specifically
looking at ashkenazic history in each module there will be a selection of videos then there will be
a a self-test quiz which is very low pressure there is no grades attached to this just a sense
of letting you know how much you've learned and giving you a sense of whether you should really
be reviewing it once again or not before the discussion and then there's also going to
be a class discussion where you can have a more carefully curated and moderated discussion that's
not open to hoi polloi as we have on youtube and i hope to participate in a lot of these things
as well so you'll see me popping up inside from time to time that's basically oh there's a nice
certificate of completion at the end so that's it i i hope you enjoy this course i'm really looking
forward to participating learning with you and i'm looking forward to hearing your comments on
what you think of this experiment at the very end okay thank you very much and let's get learning
